Recipe.Description: Mmm . . . Lobster . . . According to Thomas Keller, plunging lobster into boiling water causes the exterior surface of the meat to toughen and become impervious to any external, additional flavors you might want to add. Also, since different parts of the lobster cook at different rates, by the time the claws are done the tails are overcooked -stringy and rubbery. Keller advises a preparation somewhere between blanching/par-boiling and poaching, pouring boiling water over lobsters and letting them set a few minutes, before extracting the meat for other cooking techniques. This recipe is based on Keller's technique. The butter poached lobster can be used as is, or in other recipes. Ron_Siegel used it to beat Hiroyuki_Sakai on Iron Chef.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Obtain pot larger enough to contain lobsters.

Method.Step: Pack lobsters in large pot. Add water to cover lobsters.
Add 1/2 cup of vinegar for every 8 quarts of water.
Turn off heat. Add lobsters to water.
Let lobster steep in water. About two minutes for 1-1/2 pound lobsters or 3 minutes for 2 pound lobsters.
Remove lobsters from pot. Twist of tails and set aside. Twist off claws and return to water for an additional five minutes.
Remove claws from pot. Crack shells and remove meat.
Remove tail meat from shells. Remove vein and slice in half lengthwise.
Place lobster meat in sauce pan.
Add beurre monté to pan with lobster pieces and hold temperature at 160-180 degrees for 5-6 minutes.
